children.subject: No prior teaching experience is necessary! We would love to have you if you're interested in teaching and willing to put time into the class :)
A follow-up: When should I expect to hear back about my application status?
We will get back to everyone by 12/1
If we haven't heard back by 12/1 should we assume that we didn't get the TA position? Or will you be sending out rejections as well?
Do we need to take CS-teaching courses to be a TA?

This decal is targeted at students who are currently recruiting for SWE internships or wish to prepare for the recruiting process. Our only prerequisite is 61A or a similar programming background— we don’t require knowledge of CS170, and we promise to teach any of the related topics that are necessary!
Who is the target demographic for this class? Is CS170 recommended before taking this decal?

Knowledge of 61B and 170 would be good to have. Most importantly, though, we are looking for people familiar with leetcode style questions and leetcode style algorithms. Feel free to apply if you are confident on the topics listed in the syllabus :)
What classes should someone interested in TAing have completed? Up to 61B?
I just found out about this and I think I'm pretty qualified to help teach; is it too late to apply?

history.content:
We are looking for other fantastic humans to help us build out the first iteration of our decal, Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking. Not only will you optionally get 2 (count em, TWO) units for TA'ing this class with us, you will also get to hold one office hour a week, help us prepare solutions videos for problems, and help mentor a fabulous class of hundreds of students. No prerequisites are necessary, just an enjoyment of Leetcode/Hackerrank style coding questions and a genuine interest in teaching. All you need to do to apply is fill out this form: www.tinyurl.com/leetcode101-ta

 

Ask us any questions you have about the class as a followup below :).

<3, Michael and Kathy

Course Description:

Coding interviews often require a skill set that is not fully covered by the undergraduate CS curriculum. Rather than leave students to learn these skills on their own, Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking attempts to bridge the gap between traditional computer science coursework and the industry recruiting process. With mock interviews and practice problems curated by frequency, Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking provides a hands on and practical approach to learning how to code algorithms commonly seen in software engineering interviews.

Course Syllabus:

Introduction-to-Algorithmic-Thinking-Syllabus.pdf

history.subject: Leetcode 101 Decal: TA applications!

history.content:
We're currently looking for TAs to join the team – if you have coding interview and/or algorithms experience and are interested in helping us teach this introductory course, we encourage you to apply at https://tinyurl.com/leetcode101-ta. Besides answering questions during class, TAs attend remote staff meetings on Tuesdays before classtime, 5:00–6:30pm, host their own office hours, and help revise our curriculum. You can also get 2 PNP units for this.

Feel free to post follow-ups if you have any questions about the course or the TA app!

Course Description:

Coding interviews often require a skill set that is not fully covered by the undergraduate CS curriculum. Rather than leave students to learn these skills on their own, Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking attempts to bridge the gap between traditional computer science coursework and the industry recruiting process. With mock interviews and practice problems curated by frequency, Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking provides a hands on and practical approach to learning how to code algorithms commonly seen in software engineering interviews.
